marketing.howto.ops.title: Operations: Monitoring, Scaling, Quality
marketing.howto.ops.description: How to run Sigmacode Chat AI reliably in production: Frontend (Vite) at http://localhost:3092, Backend at http://localhost:3081. Infrastructure via Docker: MongoDB 27017, Meilisearch 7700, Redis 6380, VectorDB 5433, RAG API 8000. Start the backend with CONFIG_PATH=/Users/msc/Desktop/Sigmacodeai/config/librechat.yaml. Track latency, error rate, and throughput; scale services deliberately and continuously evaluate model quality.
marketing.howto.ops.items.metrics.title: Observability & SLOs
marketing.howto.ops.items.metrics.desc: Track metrics & logs per service: API 3081, Frontend 3092, Mongo 27017, Redis 6380, Meilisearch 7700, VectorDB 5433, RAG 8000. Define SLOs (e.g., P95 < 1.5s, error rate < 1%) and alerts.
marketing.howto.ops.items.scaling.title: Scaling & Resilience
marketing.howto.ops.items.scaling.desc: Horizontal scaling of stateless components (frontend/backend), caching via Redis, search index tuning in Meilisearch, connection pools for Mongo/VectorDB, health checks & auto-restarts.
marketing.howto.ops.items.eval.title: Evaluation & Quality Assurance
marketing.howto.ops.items.eval.desc: Measure prompt/response quality (A/B), verify RAG hit rates, reduce hallucinations, monitor rate limits and costs. Run evaluation jobs against RAG API (8000) and model providers.
marketing.howto.ops.items.runbooks.title: Runbooks & Playbooks
marketing.howto.ops.items.runbooks.desc: Standardized incident response: incident runbooks, emergency procedures, escalation paths, postmortems.
marketing.howto.ops.items.alerts.title: Alerts & Dashboards
marketing.howto.ops.items.alerts.desc: Metric- and log-based alerts (P95, error rate, costs), centralized dashboards with drill-down and SLO tracking.
marketing.howto.cta.title: Start Productively Now
marketing.howto.cta.subtitle: Create a new conversation or plan scaling with our pricing calculator.

marketing.landing.providers.title: Models & Providers
marketing.landing.providers.description: Multi‑provider by design. BYOK or managed – use leading LLMs.
marketing.landing.providers.details.open: GPT‑4o, o3, Realtime, Vision · up to 128k context
Full support for chat, tools and vision. BYOK or via managed proxy, with rate limits and cost controls.
marketing.landing.providers.details.anth: Great for long contexts and structured answers. Solid tool use and robust safety.
marketing.landing.providers.details.mist: Mistral Large/Small · efficient · EU hosting options
Lightweight, fast and cost‑effective. A good choice for latency‑sensitive workloads.
marketing.landing.providers.details.groq: Llama/Gemma on LPU · extremely low latency
Excellent for real‑time interaction and streaming apps. Very low response times.
marketing.landing.providers.details.deep: Strong price/performance focus on reasoning and coding tasks.
marketing.landing.providers.details.goog: Enterprise features via Vertex AI: governance, monitoring, policies and scaling included.
marketing.landing.providers.details.azur: Enterprise security · Private Link · regional control
Microsoft ecosystem, compliance & network isolation. Ideal for regulated environments.
marketing.landing.providers.details.aws-: Anthropic / Meta / Mistral via Bedrock · IAM & regions
Central access to multiple models with AWS IAM, observability and region choice.
marketing.landing.providers.details.open: Routing across many models · price/quality mix
Flexibly access a broad selection of models. Optimize routing, pricing and availability.

marketing.providers.index.title: LLM Providers
marketing.providers.index.subtitle: Overview of models, strengths and use cases
marketing.howto.meta.title: How it works
marketing.howto.meta.description: From connection and orchestration to deployment, governance, and operations: how to run Sigmacode Chat AI securely and at scale.
marketing.howto.hero.title: How Sigmacode Chat AI Works
marketing.howto.hero.subtitle: Connect. Orchestrate. Deploy. Govern. Operate.
marketing.howto.connect.title: Connect systems & data
marketing.howto.connect.description: Wire up actions/tools, data sources (RAG), and providers. Secure secrets, clear access paths, consistent schemas.
marketing.howto.connect.items.actions.de: Define secure actions (e.g., code, webhooks, file I/O) with clear scopes and rate limits.
marketing.howto.connect.items.data.title: Data & RAG
marketing.howto.connect.items.data.desc: Ingest into VectorDB (5433), index in Meilisearch (7700), consistent embeddings and metadata.
Integrate multiple LLMs/providers, set fallbacks, observe cost and latency.
marketing.howto.connect.items.secrets.de: Secure management of API keys and credentials, rotation, least-privilege for actions and providers.
marketing.howto.connect.items.webhooks.d: Event-driven integrations (inbound/outbound) with signature verification, retries & backoff, idempotency keys.
marketing.howto.orchestrate.title: Steer flows & agents
marketing.howto.orchestrate.description: Planner, multi-agent, and artifacts structure your end-to-end flow including checks.
marketing.howto.orchestrate.items.planne: Break down tasks, derive tools/prompts, define steps with abort/retry strategy.
marketing.howto.orchestrate.items.moA.de: Role-based (planner, executor, reviewer). Hand-offs, quality gates, structured outputs.
marketing.howto.orchestrate.items.artifa: Version intermediate results (files/JSON), validate (zod), and reuse them.
marketing.howto.orchestrate.items.guardr: Validation and policy checks, content safety, rate limits, output schemas; automatic aborts/retries.
marketing.howto.deploy.title: Rollout & environments
marketing.howto.deploy.s1.title: Dev & Staging
marketing.howto.deploy.s1.desc: Local: Frontend 3092, Backend 3081; Docker services (Mongo 27017, Redis 6380, Meilisearch 7700, VectorDB 5433, RAG 8000).
marketing.howto.deploy.s2.title: Configuration
marketing.howto.deploy.s2.desc: Set secrets/keys, provider settings, CONFIG_PATH; define health checks & liveness probes.
marketing.howto.deploy.s3.title: Rollout
marketing.howto.deploy.s3.desc: Zero-downtime deployments, migrations, index builds; enable monitoring at go-live.
marketing.howto.deploy.s4.title: CI/CD & Pipelines
marketing.howto.deploy.s4.desc: Build, test, lint, security scan, containerize; promotions with gates and manual approval.
marketing.howto.deploy.s5.title: Migrations & Rollback
marketing.howto.deploy.s5.desc: Database migrations (Prisma), index migrations (Meilisearch/VectorDB) with rollback strategy.
marketing.howto.gov.title: Security & Policies
marketing.howto.gov.items.policies.title: Policies
marketing.howto.gov.items.policies.desc: Input/output filters, PII redaction, content safety, approval flows.
marketing.howto.gov.items.secrets.title: Secrets
marketing.howto.gov.items.secrets.desc: Secure secret management, rotation, least-privilege for actions and providers.
marketing.howto.gov.items.compliance.des: Audit logs, GDPR, retention, consent and deletion workflows, privacy notices.
marketing.howto.gov.items.rbac.title: RBAC & Tenancy
marketing.howto.gov.items.rbac.desc: Roles/permissions, tenant isolation, access paths per organization/project, approved actions.
marketing.howto.gov.items.audit.title: Audit & Traceability
marketing.howto.gov.items.audit.desc: End-to-end trace IDs, tamper-proof logs, request/response records, evidence for reviews.
marketing.howto.faq.title: Frequently Asked Questions
marketing.howto.faq.q1.a: Frontend 3092, Backend 3081, Mongo 27017, Meilisearch 7700, Redis 6380, VectorDB 5433, RAG 8000.
marketing.howto.faq.q2.q: How do I start the backend correctly?
marketing.howto.faq.q3.q: How do I ensure quality in operations?
marketing.howto.faq.q3.a: Observability (P95, errors), A/B evaluation, RAG recall, cost/rate limits and guardrails.
marketing.howto.faq.q4.q: How do I handle rate limits and cost control?
marketing.howto.faq.q4.a: Model provider limits per minute/hour, backoff/queueing, cost budgets, alerting and fallback providers.
marketing.howto.faq.q5.q: How do I safely update vectorizations/indexes?
marketing.howto.faq.q5.a: Batch reindex with shadow index, consistent switchover, canary traffic, rollback to old index on metric degradation.

marketing.agents.hero.title: AI Agents – Orchestration, RAG & Secure Actions
marketing.agents.hero.subtitle: Overview, orchestration & security – RAG, actions, policies.
marketing.agents.hero.subtitle_q: How do I orchestrate multiple agents — securely and productively?
marketing.agents.hero.subtitle_body: Orchestrate multiple agents with RAG & file search, secure OpenAPI actions and workflows. Policies, audit logs and multi‑model deliver reproducible, measurable outcomes — production‑ready.
marketing.landing.whatAreAgents.title: What are AI agents?
marketing.landing.whatAreAgents.descript: AI agents are specialized assistants that autonomously execute tasks with tools (e.g., RAG, OCR, Actions, MCP, Code Interpreter), files, and clear policies – far beyond classic prompting. Orchestrate multiple agents into chains (mixture‑of‑agents) and measurably accelerate workflows.
marketing.landing.whatAreAgents.titleKic: How do I orchestrate multiple agents?
marketing.landing.whatAreAgents.subtitle: Combine context, tools and policies deliberately. More autonomy, shorter cycle times – safely coordinated (mixture‑of‑agents).
marketing.landing.whatAreAgents.orchestr: How do I orchestrate multiple agents?
marketing.landing.whatAreAgents.points.0: Structured sources, file search and context‑rich answers.
marketing.landing.whatAreAgents.points.1: OpenAPI/MCP actions with scopes, rate limits and audit.
marketing.landing.whatAreAgents.points.2: Guardrails, roles and approvals — reproducible and safe.
marketing.landing.whatAreAgents.flow.pla: Decompose tasks, define roles, policies & tools.
marketing.landing.whatAreAgents.flow.act: Execution via secure actions, structured outputs.
marketing.landing.whatAreAgents.flow.ver: Review, log, iterate — make quality measurable.
marketing.landing.faq.title: Frequently asked questions
marketing.landing.faq.items.0.q: Do I need a credit card?
marketing.landing.faq.items.0.a: No. You can start right away with the Starter plan and try our platform without any payment details. We only ask for billing information when you upgrade later – transparent, fair, and cancel anytime.
marketing.landing.faq.items.1.a: Yes. For enterprise customers we offer on‑prem deployments as well as hybrid setups. Policies, keys, and logs remain under your control; we assist with architecture review and hardening recommendations.
marketing.landing.faq.items.2.a: Security is built‑in by design: encryption at rest & in transit, fine‑grained RBAC, audit logs, strict secrets handling, plus optional PII redaction. Data residency options provide additional compliance if needed.
marketing.landing.faq.items.3.q: Which models and providers are supported?
marketing.landing.faq.items.3.a: We support multiple leading providers (e.g., OpenAI, Anthropic, Google, Mistral) and let you choose per use case. With multi‑provider you can dynamically optimize quality, cost, and latency.
marketing.landing.faq.items.4.q: Can I use my own API keys (BYOK)?
marketing.landing.faq.items.4.a: Yes. With Bring‑Your‑Own‑Key you integrate your own provider access. Keys are stored securely, never bundled in the client, and only used according to defined policies.
marketing.landing.faq.items.5.q: How do RAG and file search work?
marketing.landing.faq.items.5.a: Documents are indexed in a vector store (e.g., PGVector). For a query, semantically relevant passages are extracted and appended to the prompt, making answers grounded, justified, and traceable.
marketing.landing.faq.items.6.a: We support common formats like PDF, DOCX, TXT, Markdown, HTML, CSV and JSON as well as images via OCR. The pipeline is modular and can be extended with additional formats as needed.
marketing.landing.faq.items.7.q: What is the Model Context Protocol (MCP)?
marketing.landing.faq.items.7.a: The Model Context Protocol is an open standard to securely connect tools and data sources to models. It defines clear policies, scopes, and audits – ideal for controlled, reproducible automations.
marketing.landing.faq.items.8.a: Endpoints described via OpenAPI are exposed as executable actions. With authentication, rate limits, and permissions, you precisely control which operations agents are allowed to perform.
marketing.landing.faq.items.9.a: Yes. We operate in line with GDPR, support EU data residency, provide DPAs, and offer audit capabilities. This helps meet regulatory requirements demonstrably.
marketing.landing.faq.items.10.q: How do authentication and SSO work?
marketing.landing.faq.items.10.a: We support SAML/SSO and OAuth/OIDC, complemented by role‑based access control (RBAC). Identity flows are audit‑proof and can be aligned with company policies.
marketing.landing.faq.items.11.a: Streaming responses, caching, and efficient pipelines noticeably reduce latency. Optionally, multi‑region deployments route traffic geographically closer to users.
marketing.landing.faq.items.12.q: Are there rate limits and quotas?
marketing.landing.faq.items.12.a: Yes. Limits and quotas are configurable per plan, project, or tool. Integrated monitoring with alerts helps keep usage and costs under control at all times.
marketing.landing.faq.items.13.q: How does the no‑code Agent Studio work?
marketing.landing.faq.items.13.a: In the visual studio you define roles, policies, tools, storage, and chains (MoA) without writing code. Versioning, export, and team collaboration are integrated from the start.
marketing.landing.faq.items.14.a: Beyond no‑code features, you can integrate custom logic as actions, via serverless functions, or dedicated services. For exploratory analysis, a remote code interpreter is available.
marketing.landing.faq.items.15.a: We offer integrations into databases, storage and knowledge systems, CRMs, ticketing, and BI. Connect your own systems via MCP or OpenAPI – with clear scopes and audit trails.
marketing.landing.faq.items.16.q: How are logging and monitoring handled?
marketing.landing.faq.items.16.a: Tokens, costs, and latencies are tracked as metrics, complemented by audit logs, tracing, and alerts. Exports enable analysis in your preferred BI tool.
marketing.landing.faq.items.17.a: Sensitive content can be automatically redacted (PII). Access controls, encryption, and a dedicated secrets vault provide a high level of security – including on‑prem.
marketing.landing.faq.items.18.q: Do you provide SLAs and support?
marketing.landing.faq.items.18.a: From Business and Enterprise plans onward, we offer guaranteed response times, defined channels, and dedicated contacts; optionally 24/7 on‑call for critical systems.
marketing.landing.faq.items.19.a: Yes. Start without a credit card and scale to monthly or yearly plans as needed (with 20% savings). Your progress remains portable at any time.

com_endpoint_anthropic_maxoutputtokens: Maximum number of tokens that can be generated in the response. Specify a lower value for shorter responses and a higher value for longer responses. Note: models may stop before reaching this maximum.
com_endpoint_anthropic_prompt_cache: Prompt caching allows reusing large context or instructions across API calls, reducing costs and latency
com_endpoint_anthropic_temp: Ranges from 0 to 1. Use temp closer to 0 for analytical / multiple choice, and closer to 1 for creative and generative tasks. We recommend altering this or Top P but not both.
com_endpoint_anthropic_thinking: Enables internal reasoning for supported Claude models (3.7 Sonnet). Note: requires "Thinking Budget" to be set and lower than "Max Output Tokens"
com_endpoint_anthropic_thinking_budget: Determines the max number of tokens Claude is allowed use for its internal reasoning process. Larger budgets can improve response quality by enabling more thorough analysis for complex problems, although Claude may not use the entire budget allocated, especially at ranges above 32K. This setting must be lower than "Max Output Tokens."
com_endpoint_anthropic_topk: Top-k changes how the model selects tokens for output. A top-k of 1 means the selected token is the most probable among all tokens in the model's vocabulary (also called greedy decoding), while a top-k of 3 means that the next token is selected from among the 3 most probable tokens (using temperature).
com_endpoint_anthropic_topp: Top-p changes how the model selects tokens for output. Tokens are selected from most K (see topK parameter) probable to least until the sum of their probabilities equals the top-p value.
com_endpoint_anthropic_use_web_search: Enable web search functionality using Anthropic's built-in search capabilities. This allows the model to search the web for up-to-date information and provide more accurate, current responses.
com_endpoint_assistant_placeholder: Please select an Assistant from the right-hand Side Panel
com_endpoint_config_google_api_info: To get your Generative Language API key (for Gemini),
com_endpoint_config_key_encryption: Your key will be encrypted and deleted at
com_endpoint_config_key_google_vertex_ap: Make sure to click 'Create and Continue' to give at least the 'Vertex AI User' role. Lastly, create a JSON key to import here.
com_endpoint_config_key_import_json_key_: Invalid Service Account JSON Key, Did you import the correct file?
Successfully Imported Service Account JSON Key
com_endpoint_config_placeholder: Set your Key in the Header menu to chat.
com_endpoint_context_info: The maximum number of tokens that can be used for context. Use this for control of how many tokens are sent per request. If unspecified, will use system defaults based on known models' context size. Setting higher values may result in errors and/or higher token cost.
com_endpoint_deprecated_info: This endpoint is deprecated and may be removed in future versions, please use the agent endpoint instead
com_endpoint_deprecated_info_a11y: The plugin endpoint is deprecated and may be removed in future versions, please use the agent endpoint instead
com_endpoint_disable_streaming: Disable streaming responses and receive the complete response at once. Useful for models like o3 that require organization verification for streaming
com_endpoint_func_hover: Enable use of Plugins as OpenAI Functions
com_endpoint_google_custom_name_placehol: Set a custom name for Google
com_endpoint_google_maxoutputtokens: Maximum number of tokens that can be generated in the response. Specify a lower value for shorter responses and a higher value for longer responses. Note: models may stop before reaching this maximum.
com_endpoint_google_temp: Higher values = more random, while lower values = more focused and deterministic. We recommend altering this or Top P but not both.
com_endpoint_google_thinking: Enables or disables reasoning. This setting is only supported by certain models (2.5 series). For older models, this setting may have no effect.
com_endpoint_google_thinking_budget:
Guides the number of thinking tokens the model uses. The actual amount may exceed or fall below this value depending on the prompt.

This setting is only supported by certain models (2.5 series). Gemini 2.5 Pro supports 128-32,768 tokens. Gemini 2.5 Flash supports 0-24,576 tokens. Gemini 2.5 Flash Lite supports 512-24,576 tokens.

Leave blank or set to "-1" to let the model automatically decide when and how much to think. By default, Gemini 2.5 Flash Lite does not think.
com_endpoint_google_topk: Top-k changes how the model selects tokens for output. A top-k of 1 means the selected token is the most probable among all tokens in the model's vocabulary (also called greedy decoding), while a top-k of 3 means that the next token is selected from among the 3 most probable tokens (using temperature).
com_endpoint_google_topp: Top-p changes how the model selects tokens for output. Tokens are selected from most K (see topK parameter) probable to least until the sum of their probabilities equals the top-p value.
com_endpoint_google_use_search_grounding: Use Google's search grounding feature to enhance responses with real-time web search results. This enables models to access current information and provide more accurate, up-to-date answers.
com_endpoint_instructions_assistants_pla: Overrides the instructions of the assistant. This is useful for modifying the behavior on a per-run basis.
com_endpoint_no_presets: No presets yet, use the settings button to create one
com_endpoint_openai_custom_name_placehol: Set a custom name for the AI
com_endpoint_openai_detail: The resolution for Vision requests. "Low" is cheaper and faster, "High" is more detailed and expensive, and "Auto" will automatically choose between the two based on the image resolution.
com_endpoint_openai_freq: Number between -2.0 and 2.0. Positive values penalize new tokens based on their existing frequency in the text so far, decreasing the model's likelihood to repeat the same line verbatim.
com_endpoint_openai_max: The max tokens to generate. The total length of input tokens and generated tokens is limited by the model's context length.
com_endpoint_openai_max_tokens: Optional 'max_tokens' field, representing the maximum number of tokens that can be generated in the chat completion. The total length of input tokens and generated tokens is limited by the models context length. You may experience errors if this number exceeds the max context tokens.
com_endpoint_openai_pres: Number between -2.0 and 2.0. Positive values penalize new tokens based on whether they appear in the text so far, increasing the model's likelihood to talk about new topics.
com_endpoint_openai_prompt_prefix_placeh: Set custom instructions to include in System Message. Default: none
com_endpoint_openai_reasoning_effort: Reasoning models only: constrains effort on reasoning. Reducing reasoning effort can result in faster responses and fewer tokens used on reasoning in a response. 'Minimal' produces very few reasoning tokens for fastest time-to-first-token, especially well-suited for coding and instruction following.
com_endpoint_openai_reasoning_summary: Responses API only: A summary of the reasoning performed by the model. This can be useful for debugging and understanding the model's reasoning process. Set to none,auto, concise, or detailed.
com_endpoint_openai_resend: Resend all previously attached images. Note: this can significantly increase token cost and you may experience errors with many image attachments.
com_endpoint_openai_resend_files: Resend all previously attached files. Note: this will increase token cost and you may experience errors with many attachments.
com_endpoint_openai_stop: Up to 4 sequences where the API will stop generating further tokens.
com_endpoint_openai_temp: Higher values = more random, while lower values = more focused and deterministic. We recommend altering this or Top P but not both.
com_endpoint_openai_topp: An alternative to sampling with temperature, called nucleus sampling, where the model considers the results of the tokens with top_p probability mass. So 0.1 means only the tokens comprising the top 10% probability mass are considered. We recommend altering this or temperature but not both.
com_endpoint_openai_use_responses_api: Use the Responses API instead of Chat Completions, which includes extended features from OpenAI. Required for o1-pro, o3-pro, and to enable reasoning summaries.
com_endpoint_openai_use_web_search: Enable web search functionality using OpenAI's built-in search capabilities. This allows the model to search the web for up-to-date information and provide more accurate, current responses.
com_endpoint_openai_verbosity: Constrains the verbosity of the model's response. Lower values will result in more concise responses, while higher values will result in more verbose responses. Currently supported values are low, medium, and high.
com_endpoint_plug_set_custom_instruction: Set custom instructions to include in System Message. Default: none
com_endpoint_preset_custom_name_placehol: something needs to go here. was empty
com_endpoint_preset_default_removed: is no longer the default preset.
com_endpoint_preset_delete_confirm: Are you sure you want to delete this preset?
com_endpoint_preset_delete_error: There was an error deleting your preset. Please try again.
com_endpoint_preset_import_error: There was an error importing your preset. Please try again.
com_endpoint_preset_save_error: There was an error saving your preset. Please try again.
com_endpoint_presets_clear_warning: Are you sure you want to clear all presets? This is irreversible.
com_endpoint_prompt_prefix_assistants_pl: Set additional instructions or context on top of the Assistant's main instructions. Ignored if empty.
com_endpoint_prompt_prefix_placeholder: Set custom instructions or context. Ignored if empty.
com_endpoint_set_custom_name: Set a custom name, in case you can find this preset
com_endpoint_skip_hover: Enable skipping the completion step, which reviews the final answer and generated steps
com_error_endpoint_models_not_loaded: Models for {{0}} could not be loaded. Please refresh the page and try again.
com_error_expired_user_key: Provided key for {{0}} expired at {{1}}. Please provide a new key and try again.
com_error_files_process: An error occurred while processing the file.
com_error_files_unsupported_capability: No capabilities enabled that support this file type.
com_error_files_upload: An error occurred while uploading the file.
com_error_files_upload_canceled: The file upload request was canceled. Note: the file upload may still be processing and will need to be manually deleted.
com_error_files_validation: An error occurred while validating the file.
com_error_google_tool_conflict: Usage of built-in Google tools are not supported with external tools. Please disable either the built-in tools or the external tools.
com_error_heic_conversion: Failed to convert HEIC image to JPEG. Please try converting the image manually or use a different format.
com_error_illegal_model_request: The model "{{0}}" is not available for {{1}}. Please select a different model.
com_error_input_length: The latest message token count is too long, exceeding the token limit, or your token limit parameters are misconfigured, adversely affecting the context window. More info: {{0}}. Please shorten your message, adjust the max context size from the conversation parameters, or fork the conversation to continue.
com_error_invalid_agent_provider: The "{{0}}" provider is not available for use with Agents. Please go to your agent's settings and select a currently available provider.
com_error_invalid_user_key: Invalid key provided. Please provide a valid key and try again.
com_error_missing_model: No model selected for {{0}}. Please select a model and try again.
com_error_models_not_loaded: Models configuration could not be loaded. Please refresh the page and try again.
com_error_moderation: It appears that the content submitted has been flagged by our moderation system for not aligning with our community guidelines. We're unable to proceed with this specific topic. If you have any other questions or topics you'd like to explore, please edit your message, or create a new conversation.
com_error_no_base_url: No base URL found. Please provide one and try again.
com_error_no_user_key: No key found. Please provide a key and try again.

com_nav_at_command_description: Toggle command "@" for switching endpoints, models, presets, etc.
com_nav_auto_scroll: Auto-Scroll to latest message on chat open
com_nav_balance_next_refill_info: The next refill will occur automatically only when both conditions are met: the designated time interval has passed since the last refill, and sending a prompt would cause your balance to drop below zero.
com_nav_center_chat_input: Center Chat Input on Welcome Screen
com_nav_chat_commands_info: These commands are activated by typing specific characters at the beginning of your message. Each command is triggered by its designated prefix. You can disable them if you frequently use these characters to start messages.
com_nav_clear_cache_confirm_message: Are you sure you want to clear the cache?
com_nav_clear_conversation_confirm_messa: Are you sure you want to clear all conversations? This is irreversible.
com_nav_delete_data_info: All your data will be deleted.
com_nav_delete_warning: WARNING: This will permanently delete your account.
com_nav_info_balance: Balance shows how many token credits you have left to use. Token credits translate to monetary value (e.g., 1000 credits = $0.001 USD)
com_nav_info_code_artifacts: Enables the display of experimental code artifacts next to the chat
com_nav_info_code_artifacts_agent: Enables the use of code artifacts for this agent. By default, additional instructions specific to the use of artifacts are added, unless "Custom Prompt Mode" is enabled.
com_nav_info_custom_prompt_mode: When enabled, the default artifacts system prompt will not be included. All artifact-generating instructions must be provided manually in this mode.
com_nav_info_enter_to_send: When enabled, pressing `ENTER` will send your message. When disabled, pressing Enter will add a new line, and you'll need to press `CTRL + ENTER` / `⌘ + ENTER` to send your message.
com_nav_info_fork_change_default: `Visible messages only` includes just the direct path to the selected message. `Include related branches` adds branches along the path. `Include all to/from here` includes all connected messages and branches.
com_nav_info_fork_split_target_setting: When enabled, forking will commence from the target message to the latest message in the conversation, according to the behavior selected.
com_nav_info_include_shadcnui: When enabled, instructions for using shadcn/ui components will be included. shadcn/ui is a collection of re-usable components built using Radix UI and Tailwind CSS. Note: these are lengthy instructions, you should only enable if informing the LLM of the correct imports and components is important to you. For more information about these components, visit: https://ui.shadcn.com/
com_nav_info_latex_parsing: When enabled, LaTeX code in messages will be rendered as mathematical equations. Disabling this may improve performance if you don't need LaTeX rendering.
com_nav_info_save_badges_state: When enabled, the state of the chat badges will be saved. This means that if you create a new chat, the badges will remain in the same state as the previous chat. If you disable this option, the badges will reset to their default state every time you create a new chat
com_nav_info_save_draft: When enabled, the text and attachments you enter in the chat form will be automatically saved locally as drafts. These drafts will be available even if you reload the page or switch to a different conversation. Drafts are stored locally on your device and are deleted once the message is sent.
com_nav_info_show_thinking: When enabled, the chat will display the thinking dropdowns open by default, allowing you to view the AI's reasoning in real-time. When disabled, the thinking dropdowns will remain closed by default for a cleaner and more streamlined interface
com_nav_info_user_name_display: When enabled, the username of the sender will be shown above each message you send. When disabled, you will only see "You" above your messages.
com_nav_latex_parsing: Parsing LaTeX in messages (may affect performance)
com_nav_long_audio_warning: Longer texts will take longer to process.

com_ui_agent_chain_info: Enables creating sequences of agents. Each agent can access outputs from previous agents in the chain. Based on the "Mixture-of-Agents" architecture where agents use previous outputs as auxiliary information.

com_ui_fork_info_1: Use this setting to fork messages with the desired behavior.
com_ui_fork_info_2: "Forking" refers to creating a new conversation that start/end from specific messages in the current conversation, creating a copy according to the options selected.
com_ui_fork_info_3: The "target message" refers to either the message this popup was opened from, or, if you check "{{0}}", the latest message in the conversation.
com_ui_fork_info_branches: This option forks the visible messages, along with related branches; in other words, the direct path to the target message, including branches along the path.
com_ui_fork_info_remember: Check this to remember the options you select for future usage, making it quicker to fork conversations as preferred.
com_ui_fork_info_start: If checked, forking will commence from this message to the latest message in the conversation, according to the behavior selected above.
com_ui_fork_info_target: This option forks all messages leading up to the target message, including its neighbors; in other words, all message branches, whether or not they are visible or along the same path, are included.
com_ui_fork_info_visible: This option forks only the visible messages; in other words, the direct path to the target message, without any branches.

pricing.interval.label: Pricing interval

footer.brand_tagline: Modern AI platform for teams and enterprises. Secure, extensible and production-ready.

newsletter.title: Stay in the loop
newsletter.subtitle: Product updates, best practices and exclusive insights. No spam.
newsletter.label: Email address
newsletter.consent: I agree to the processing of my data in accordance with the

0.title: AI Agents (No‑Code)
0.desc: Build specialized agents with tools, policies and chains (MoA).

1.title: RAG & File Search
1.desc: Semantic search, context from files, PGVector‑based.

2.title: Actions & MCP
2.desc: OpenAPI actions and Model Context Protocol for secure tool use.

3.title: Artifacts & Code
3.desc: Interactive outputs (React/HTML/Mermaid) and Remote Code Interpreter.

4.title: Performance
4.desc: Streaming, caching and efficient pipelines for low latency.

5.title: Security by design
5.desc: RBAC, audit logs, secret handling, GDPR, on‑prem/hybrid.

0.title: RBAC & granular permissions
0.desc: Role‑based access with fine‑grained scopes, projects/workspaces and attribute‑based rules.

1.title: Audit logs & traceability
1.desc: Complete event logging with export, retention policies and integrity checks (hash chains).

2.title: Secure secret handling
2.desc: End‑to‑end encryption at rest, just‑in‑time decryption, rotation and bring‑your‑own KMS.

3.title: GDPR & data sovereignty
3.desc: On‑prem/hybrid deployment, regional data residency, deletion concepts, data processing agreements and TOMs.

hardening.title: State‑of‑the‑art encryption
hardening.desc: TLS 1.3, at‑rest AES‑256, optional HSM/KMS integration, secrets in RAM only, zero‑trust principles.

audit.title: Compliance & evidence
audit.desc: Exportable audit logs, tamper‑evident storage, verifiable for internal/external audits.

data.title: Data sovereignty & residency
data.desc: Regional storage, deletion workflows, BYO infra (on‑prem/hybrid/private cloud) for enterprise.

providers.title: Supported models & providers
providers.description: Multi‑provider by design — BYOK (bring your own key) or managed. Use the power of leading LLMs.

pricing.title: Pricing
pricing.description: Monthly or yearly — fair and transparent.

0.q: Do I need a credit card?
0.a: No. You can try the Starter plan without a credit card.

1.a: Yes. Enterprise supports on‑prem and hybrid setups.

2.a: Encryption, RBAC, audit logs, secret handling and least‑privilege — secure by design.

3.q: Which models and providers are supported?
3.a: Multiple AI providers (e.g., OpenAI, Anthropic, Google, Mistral). Multi‑provider lets you optimize cost/quality per use case.

4.q: Can I bring my own keys (BYOK)?
4.a: Yes. BYOK is supported — keys are stored securely and never bundled in the client.

5.q: How does RAG & file search work?
5.a: Via semantic search with vector databases (e.g. PGVector). Files are indexed and relevant snippets are attached to prompts.

6.a: Typical: PDF, DOCX, TXT, Markdown, HTML, CSV, JSON, images with OCR. Extensible as needed.

7.q: What is the Model Context Protocol (MCP)?
7.a: MCP standardizes secure tool integrations. Connect actions, internal systems and knowledge bases with clear policies.

8.a: API endpoints described by OpenAPI can be used securely as tools — including auth, rate limits and scopes.

9.a: Yes. GDPR‑grade processing, optional EU data residency, data processing agreements and audit features.

10.a: SAML/SSO, OAuth/OIDC and role‑based access control (RBAC) — with audit logs.

11.a: Streaming, caching and efficient pipelines reduce time‑to‑first‑token and overall latency. Multi‑region optional.

12.q: Are there rate limits and quotas?
12.a: Yes. Limits can be defined per plan, project and tool. Monitoring & alerts help capacity planning.

13.q: How does the no‑code agent studio work?
13.a: Agents are configured from roles, policies, tools, memory and chains (MoA) — without code. Export/versioning available.

14.q: Can I add my own logic/code?
14.a: Yes. Via actions, serverless functions or your services. Remote Code Interpreter provides a secure runtime.

15.a: Databases, storage, knowledge bases, CRMs, ticketing, BI, internal APIs — extensible via MCP/OpenAPI.

16.q: How do logging and monitoring work?
16.a: Central metrics (tokens, cost, latency), audit logs, prompt/output tracing, error alerts and export.

17.a: PII redaction, encryption, access control, secrets vault and optional self‑hosting/on‑prem.

18.q: Do you offer SLAs and support?
18.a: Yes. From Business/Enterprise with response times, support channels, dedicated contacts and optional 24/7.

19.a: Yes. Starter plan, no credit card required. Upgrade monthly or yearly (‑20%).

connect.title: Connect
connect.desc: Providers & data sources (OpenAI, Anthropic, Mistral, RAG API, databases, webhooks).

orchestrate.title: Orchestrate
orchestrate.desc: Configure agents: tools, policies, chains (max steps), permissions.

deploy.title: Deploy
deploy.desc: Test, release and scale — with monitoring, RBAC and SLA.

items.1: “We automated 30% of support tickets — with clear policies.”

support.title: Support automation
support.desc: Reduce tickets with intelligent self‑service agents.

integrations.title: Integrations
integrations.subtitle: Connect databases, APIs, knowledge bases and internal systems.
integrations.description: Connect databases, APIs, knowledge bases and internal systems.
integrations.lead: Integrations connect your AI agents and workflows with external services and data sources — e.g., models, vector stores, CRMs, ticketing or internal APIs. This enables secure data flow into prompts, actions and automations.
integrations.lead2: Each icon represents a typical connection. You define scopes and permissions per project — including BYOK, granular access and audit logs.

0.title: Databases
0.desc: Connect fast, authenticate securely, ship instantly.

1.title: APIs & Webhooks
1.desc: Secure actions via OpenAPI and policies.

postgres.title: PostgreSQL
postgres.desc: Query structured data and connect securely.

apis.title: REST & GraphQL APIs
apis.desc: Trigger tools, sync data and execute actions.

knowledge.title: Knowledge bases (Confluence/Wiki)
knowledge.desc: Index docs, semantic search, cite answers.

crm.title: CRM/Support (Zendesk/HubSpot)
crm.desc: Analyze tickets, generate replies, derive KPIs.

storage.title: S3/Blob Storage
storage.desc: Manage files, generate embeddings, share securely.

whatAreAgents.title: What are AI agents?
whatAreAgents.description: AI agents are specialized assistants that use tools (e.g., RAG, OCR, actions, MCP, code interpreter), files and clear policies to autonomously accomplish tasks — far beyond classic prompting. Orchestrate multiple agents into chains (mixture‑of‑agents) to measurably speed up workflows.

hero.title: AI Agents & Orchestration for Business
hero.subtitle: From single agent to multi-agent systems with policies, RAG and observability.
hero.primary_aria: Open AI Chat to test agents in a new tab
